content: Excellent UX
Hands down the most robust and best featured ad free lemmy app.
Excellent!
Hands down one of the best Lemmy apps, and it's free and open-source!
Excellent Lemmy App. This is a very exciting time for the platform and Voyager has the potential to play a big role. Looking forward to seeing progress
I think its better than sync or infintlity for lemmy. Im crurrently using the PWA since its more updated and using Opera's datasaving to make image load faster even when using mobile data.
I just think it's neat.
One of the best clients for lemmy. Open source as well. People please consider contributing money or code towards the development and upkeep of this client
My favorite way to use Lemmy. Great app!
Good start but needs an option to download media and an exit button , slightly laggy, and back button still don't work for me
Now this, this is clean as hell
Perfect! My new favorite lemmy client!
This is the lemmy app I'm enjoying the most :) Thank you!
Great keep it up!
Beautiful app for lemmy
Currently my favourite Lemmy app for Android! Still reckon Wefwef was a better name though.
Excellent app for lemmy social media
Brilliant app for Lemmy, updated constantly. Very similar to Apollo for iOS.

Voyager, originally the wefwef pwa, is now a native android app and continues to remain my favorite client for browsing Lemmy. The interface is clean and readable and there are numerous ways to customize your experience.
Best mobile app for Lemmy. Just works. No ads, no data collection, free, solid/reliable/intuitive UI. Frequent updates. Literally nothing to complain about. Hats off to the devs.
Fantastic app. Glad it's on the play store now.

Quite a good app for Lemmy, which is a good alternative of Reddit. The interface looks quite a bit like iOS. However, there aren't so many features in this app. One good thing is that there are no ads at all, and the overall experience is good. There isn't as much customizability as some other apps for Lemmy.
Very good for browsing communities and discussions. But creating new posts is cumbersome and unnatural.
Been using the PWA for a month or so and it's been by far my favorite client for viewing lemmy so far.
Best app for Lemmy, hands down! Congratulations on the app store launches!!
Voyager is definely the simplest but nicest and most straightforward app for Lemmy I've found.
Lemmy i√ßin en iyi uygulama bu bence. √ñzellikle her ≈üeyi kaydƒ±rmayla yapabiliyor olmak √ßok iyi.
I have loved this app from the very beginning, wefwef forever in my heart
Very good, but not what I was looking for.
Please add a donate button to the app and make it link to the Google wallet. This app is fantastic and I want to chip in. Thanks.
Heavenly good. Thsi morning I'm seeing a bug that in the sidebar i couldn't see the communities i subscribe to. Only the favourites.
Literally the best maintained app I've ever used, it gets better by the day. And it's already amazing at this point.
Fantastic app, great design, updated a lot and very customizable
Great alternative to Reddit. Not perfect yet.
Can't download images... Wha
Easy to use and highly customizable
I love this app. It's a really good replacement for Boost for Reddit.
Needs the ability to download pics to a specific user selected folder
perfection

This app actually is pretty good. So far seems to get about as much out of Lemmy as possible. Features are all there. The only problem I am having is getting to the comments. It might take 3 or 4 tries tapping and backing up to get to the comments. Most times it goes to the community instead. Let me know if I'm doing something wrong. You're doing great so far.
Lets one migrate subreddits, ui is better than other lemmy apps.
Apert from CLS Content Layout Shift and erratic scroll speed after viewing an image full screen I like it
Great little app

Really enjoying this app so far, but question about function: sometimes I accidentally hit the back button an extra time and lose my place in my feed. Is there a way to return to it without having to start over?
Been testing android clients for Lemmy for a while, Voyager is the most promising, so far.
Best client ever for lemmy
Best Lemmy app.

Great app. Came from a paid Boost user on Reddit. This app is great, even moreso than the ported Lemmy Boosted app for me. It's intuitive and definitely my staple for Lemmy from now on. Please keep it free of ads

Great app! However, a recent bug wherein your own posts don't load when you click on your username is quite annoying. Hope it gets fixed! EDIT: It has now been fixed, only a few days later. Thanks, Alex.
I'm a RedReader user so I particularly love the customizable swipe gestures. Looking forward to a more polished Android theme!
Gesture features and no advertising?! You guys are truly the embodiment of the fediverse. Thank you!
Cannot open lemmy links :'(

Good app, but I pretty consistently have issues logging in. It says there are "connection issues" despite not having internet issues. I can log into a browser app just fine. Once logged in, the app is great.
A really good app.
The developer is constantly improving the app.
Please add support for account profile pictures. Nonetheless, it's a great app.
Seems like a great app, but scrolling could be smoother
Not a bad app but I find the design a bit messy and the gesture system awkward to work with compared to other apps where the most used buttons are conceniently placed for one-handed use.

Now that you can disable autoplay of video/gifs. This is the app I found I like the most. It has everything I need and want. This app does deliver a lot of bells and whistles for those who want it and the ability to disable those you don't want or need.
unlike the other clients, this one doesn't harvest and sell your data. well done!
Awesome app for a a great redit alternative
Solid alternative to reddit
Besr lemmy client out there.
Kudos for all your dedicated hard work, constantly improving this splendid app for us!
Very good Lemmy client
Leftist propaganda site, any wrongthink will be banned. Garbage.
This app has a lot of strong features, but it sure crashes a lot!
Nothing to complain about üòÅ works great, with constant improvements
It's a great little application with a lot of potential.
spez made this app so much better, now its the best. Thanks spez!

Edit: Amazing app! Thanks dev for listening to the feedback!! (Original Post. Now Fixed: Good app but lacking severely in the customisation. Can't change the colour of up votes and down votes which is strange having up votes be blue.)
Love the app. But there are a few things missing: Custom Theme colors. Presets are nice, but I wanna set my own color codes. And auto-hiding of static UI when scolling down.
One the best lemme clients there is. Feature rich yet beautiful
Excellent üëå

It's a good app and the UI is actually quite good, except for the fact that I'm unable to post comments or replies. I keep getting a very generic error every single time. Hopefully they fix it soon and I'm able to revise my score.
So far so ok.
Very good in almost every way but despite having the problem instances in my block list they still regularly appear
Mods are literally worse than reddit. got a shadow ban for voicing my opinion in regards to some financial policy.
Excellent, modern, smooth, lemmy client app

-Downloaded pictures don't have their own folder, are instead dumped into the pictures folder. -Gives an error when posting (image posts, don't know about text or video ones) -Downvotes don't seem to work for some reason? Thank devs for custom themes
This is a fantastic app. It's intuitive, responsive, and highly customizable.

Great app for a feed, harder to find and browse communities. It feels like some of the sorting methods don't work like sort communities by most comments. Also on Android 9 at least, it's not an app I can quick-switch to, nor does it register that it's running, which is weird.
This is the finest Lemmy client I've ever utilized. I also appreciate the fact that the UI is cross-platform and consistent. It's exactly what I was seeking.
The list of posts you upvoted doesn't work properly on Lemmy.ml
Good app with no trackers or ads, which is the very spirit of the Fediverse!
What am I doing wrong why do I keep getting loging details are incorrect after verifying email. Im using the correct email and pw i created the account with, help
The best lemmy client I've ever used.
Utter trash of an app. Can't even create an account.
Hope dev will consider way to translate some posts into English. I want to read them but I don't see a way to translate yet.

Absolutely terrible for administering anything. You cannot even sign out or deal with other accounts, for something federated. Sure, it can look and work like some nice Reddit apps, but you cannot leverage basically anything about lemmy's federated nature. Garbage trying to be Reddit instead of something better than Reddit.
Awesome lemmy app. Really responsive dev.
Next to no customization options. Don't like the default view? Too bad
Fediverse ftw! üí™
Best lemmy client
I had to uninstall to be able to verify my account and then when 7 tried to log in, I just get a connection error, but works fine on the website in my browser
It looks like an iOS app? like it uses icons and design from iOS 7. No thank you.
what else is there to say this is the definitive Lemmy app

Great until a bubble with a 1 appeared over my settings icon. It won't go away, there's no indication whatsoever what it's there for, incredibly poor design, not too mention it's completely damn pointless nagging rubbish even if it was clear what it was for. I don't ever need a notification bubble on my settings button. Sort yourself out.

When I go to create an account, it just says 'invalid password', but doesn't tell me the password requirements. I don't know if this is a Lemmy thing or an issue with the App, but stuff like this is why federated internet will never take off. Can't even create an account.
This app is amazing! It's beautiful, it never fails, and the feature set is incredible. The dev is also very responsive to the community. I can't imagine using Lemmy without it.
Like reddit but worse
By far the best lemmy app in terms of UX. Swiping actions are ü§åüèª

Good app so far. It does have some pretty important missing features though: - Allow us to specify the download folder (important) - Add support for notifications. For messages and responses at a minimum (important) - Allow us to customise the media actions in the bottom bar, so I can download media with fewer clicks (not so important)

Voyager made the switch from Reddit to Lemmy soooo much easier to handle. I'm new to voyager, I've used a few different Reddit apps and the official one. I'm really enjoying the fresh look from voyager, yet still with enough similarities that the transition is easy.
This app is great and helped me to quickly demystify Lemmy & join a bunch of communities based off my subreddit subscriptions. I'll be recommending this to my friends as a great Reddit alternative!
Best Lemmy client.
Had some issues with my previous Lemmy client and started using this app. Excellent so far :)
Free and Open Source. No trackers and no ads.
Beautifully designed, a pleasure to use. Had to turn on the Android mode because the app has iOS design by default (the mode works well even though its still beta).

Great app, even paid some money to support it. The only thing I would give feedback on is while using a Galaxy fold 5, the bottom menu while using the outer screen is crammed and cut off. The aspect ratio needs to get fixed, but it doesn't stop the use or anything otherwise the app is fantastic and I highly recommend it.

Twice in the last few months my settings have reset to all defaults, both times I tried my backups and nothing happened, so I had to go through and set everything back to what I had all over again and lost all my tags and stuff. Not sure the purpose of the backup system is if it does nothing. üò°üò°

It has everything I need without unnecessary fluff. It even gave me a compliment (that was so unexpected but it totally brightened up a shite day). In all seriousness: Taking 10-15 minutes to acquaint myself with the app was enough to be able to navigate it. It doesn't collect nor process personal information. It's as minimal as possible without sacrificing usability. The design is plain in the best way possible. Thanks for the app!

very customizable, but relies to gestures too much, resulting in very small UI components and requiring gestures for everything. Some people will love it and enjoy it, while the gestures might be frustrating for others. Good app but not for everyone.

I've used a few different lemmy apps and this is always the one I come back to and love the most. When my last instance closed I was super sad that Voyager was not available for the new instance. Thankfully, the dev is a rock star and made my month! Soon as I can, I'm gonna donate cause the quality and features provided by this app cannot be justified by a blank price tag. It's simply too good to entertain the thought of it not existing now or in the future!
Please allow aligning the card buttons to the right, its hard to click on them with the left hand
app design excellence, reddit should take notes and learn how to make a perfect social platform app
Couldn't even get an account made even though I followed their instructions to the letter. Waste of time.
Fantastic app, runs super well. Now supports PieFed as well which is awesome! no ads. It's great!
Best mobile lemmy client I found, don't need to look any further.
Really good. The best Lemmy app by a mile.
Easily the best Lemmy client
Best I found. like RIF
